body_html:
I'm sorry, I don't quite understand what you're asking. It looks like you might be saying
p(water bottle) = 0.978
p(bottle) = 0.988
p(mug) = 0.078
and you'd like to convert these probabilities into percentages? Can you' just multiply by 100?

In any case, this issues section is more usually used for bugs and feature requests; perhaps Stack Overflow would be a better venue for this kind of question.

body:
I'm sorry, I don't quite understand what you're asking. It looks like you might be saying
p(water bottle) = 0.978
p(bottle) = 0.988
p(mug) = 0.078
and you'd like to convert these probabilities into percentages? Can you' just multiply by 100?

In any case, this issues section is more usually used for bugs and feature requests; perhaps Stack Overflow would be a better venue for this kind of question.
